abstract.text: A set of material properties that describes a basic shading model for materials, and the superclass for more complex shading models.

inlineContent.text: The set of material properties that define a materialâ€™s response to lighting is also called the
, or BRDF, for surfaces shaded using that
object. The set of properties defined by the
class itself describes a Lambertian shading model with Blinn-Phong specular response; subclasses can define a set of properties for other shading models.
Creating a new scattering function object with the inherited
method creates a set of material properties with useful default values for this shading model.

abstract.text: Implemented by subclasses to initialize a new object (the receiver) immediately after memory for it has been allocated.
Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.
A collection of material properties that together describe the intended surface appearance for rendering a 3D object.
A definition for one specific aspect of the rendering parameters for a material.
The common interface for Model I/O objects that expose a human-readable name.
A set of material properties that describes a physically realistic shading model for materials.
A set of material properties that describes a basic shading model for materials, and the superclass for more complex shading models.
The attenuation of ambient light due to local geometry variations on a surface.
The scaling factor for ambient occlusion shading.
The inherent color of the material, to be used as a modulator during shading.
The color emitted as radiance from a materialâ€™s surface.
The index of refraction for a material itself.
The index of refraction for the medium surrounding a material.
A descriptive name for the scattering function.
The variation in the surface normal vectors in a material, relative to model coordinate space.
The intensity of specular highlights on the materialâ€™s surface.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
